intro: Scaphosepalum rinkei, commonly known as the Cape flower, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that range in color from red to orange. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. It produces small, oval-shaped leaves that are arranged oppositely along the stem. Scaphosepalum rinkei is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and as a cut flower.
